column4: Epicenter is a podcast which takes you to heart of perhaps the most important technological revolution of our time, the rise of decentralized technologies. At the center of this paradigm shift are Bitcoin, blockchains, cryptocurrencies and other distributed systems, where networks form consensus to build new complex organisms which live nowhere, yet exist everywhere

column3: Gavin Wood - Polkadot - Ethereum London (from Stephan Tual's personal channel)
column4: Gavin Wood, Co-Founder of Ethereum and Founder of Parity Technologies, presents Polkadot. Polkadot is a complementary protocol that will allow for both public and private blockchains to leave their silos and interact seamlessly.

column3: Substrate An Open-Source Framework for Building Blockchains
column4:
by Shawn Tabrizi

At: FOSDEM 2019 https://video.fosdem.org/2019/H.1302/substrate.webm

Substrate is an open-source framework which allows developers to easily create new, customizable blockchains. At its heart, Substrate is a combination of three technologies: WebAssembly, Libp2p and AfG Consensus. Substrate chains have three distinct features that make them "next-generation": a dynamic, self-defining state-transition function; light-client functionality from day one; and a progressive consensus algorithm with fast block production and adaptive, definite finality. The STF, encoded in WebAssembly, is known as the "runtime". This defines the execute_block function, and can specify everything from the staking algorithm, transaction semantics, logging mechanisms and procedures for replacing any aspect of itself or of the blockchain’s state ("governance"). Because the runtime is entirely dynamic all of these can be switched out or upgraded at any time. A Substrate chain is very much a "living organism".

Substrate is being developed by Parity Technologies, a company who has build client software for multiple blockchains such as Ethereum, Bitcoin, and the upcoming Polkadot network.

column3: Intro to Kusama & Substrate, Hosted by MVP Workshop and Polkadot Belgrade
column4:
"Learn More: Substrate: http://substrate.io​Kusama: https://polkadot.network/kusama-polka...​MVP Workshop: https://mvpworkshop.co/​MVP Workshop on Kusama: https://mvpworkshop.co/blog/the-kusam...​

Bogdan Habic, Distributed systems engineer @Tenderly

Building your own Blockchain is hard. Especially enterprise-level Blockchains. Or is it? In this talk, we will what is Substrate and how it can greatly help us when building our own Blockchain from the ground up.
Filip Petrovic, Blockchain developer @MVP Workshop

How we started building a substrate module from 0 knowledge of Rust and Substrate. What challenges and problems we faced and how we overcome them.
Ivor Jugo, Blockchain researcher @MVP Workshop

The Kusama approach - What makes Kusama network different from every other."

ABOUT Cosmos is an open, distributed network of interoperable blockchains powered by the Tendermint consensus algorithm.

LINKS https://cosmos.network/​https://tendermint.com/​https://interchain.io/​

Subscribe to the channel to learn more about Cosmos. Join the newsletter by visiting https://cosmos.network​ and hitting the subscribe button. Finally, read what it's all about at https://blog.cosmos.network/"

"Overview of consensus in Substrate: Covers included engines, pluggable consensus primitives for writing your own engine. Dives into Cumulus, the consensus engine for turning substrate chains into Polkadot Parachains, and swappable consensus, for changing consensus engine mid-flight."

column3: Introduction to Substrate: A Rust based Blockchain Framework
column4: Substrate is a development framework for creating blockchains, offering different levels of abstraction depending on developer needs. It dramatically reduces the time, energy, and money required to create a new blockchain.
